alert.note: Alert for Goshen; Platte (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 21 at 7:49PM MDT until June 21 at 10:45PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Goshen County in southeastern Wyoming... Southeastern Platte County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 1045 PM MDT. * At 749 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Torrington, Chugwater, Yoder, Veteran, Hawk Springs, Slater and Huntley. Storms continue to reform in the same locations in Platte County and are moving into Goshen County previous storms have dropped 2-3 inches of rain. Small streams and ditches are likely to overtop and may affect county roads and low-lying bridges. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
